intro: Adenopa anglica, commonly known as the English adenopa, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems that are often hairy. The plant produces small, pale yellow to green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly rough texture, with a strong, aromatic scent. Adenopa anglica is often found in moist meadows and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils.
